Intro.text:
SI = HR / SBP
Used when HR and SBP do not predict severity of hypovolemia in early stages
May be used as secondary triage tool in
mass casualty incidents
[2]
0.5-0.7 is normal
>0.70-0.75 for occult shock or requirement of life-saving intervention
Simple Shock Index (sSI) was recently proposed. 
Subtracting SBP from HR is a good SI substitute. Working with integers is easier than dividing them, improving value availability.
[3]
